contingency fee.translation[0].definitio: an amount of money that a lawyer in the US will be paid only if the person they are advising wins in court
contingency fee.translation[1].definitio: when a lawyer is paid a percentage of any DAMAGEs (=money for loss or injury) that they win for their client
In settling a personal injury case, a contingency fee contract with his client gave Mr Goodman one-third of the $3 million award.
